German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German wandern, from Old High German *wantaron (“wantarōn”), from Proto-Germanic *wandrōną.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈvandɐn/
  • Hyphenation: wan‧dern
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Verb[edit]

wandern (third-person singular simple present wandert, past tense wanderte, past participle gewandert, auxiliary haben or sein)

  1. to hike
  2. to wander
